entry.et: Middle English solide, from Middle French, from Latin solidus; akin to Greek holos whole safe

def.dt: :being without an internal cavity a solid ball of rubber
:printed with minimum space between lines
:joined without a hyphen a solid compound
:not interrupted by a break or opening a solid wall
:having, involving, or dealing with three dimensions or with solids a solid configuration
:of uniformly close and coherent texture :not loose or spongy :compact
:possessing or characterized by the properties of a solid :neither gaseous nor liquid solid waste
:of good substantial quality or kind solid comfort: as
:sound solid reasons
:made firmly and well solid furniture
:reliable a solid performer
:having no break or interruption waited three solid hours
:unanimous had the solid support of the party
:intimately friendly or associated solid with the boss
:prudent
:well established financially
:serious in purpose or character
:of one substance or character: as
:entirely of one metal or containing the minimum of alloy necessary to impart hardness solid gold
:of a single color
:a geometrical figure or element (as a cube or sphere) having three dimensions see volume table

:a substance that does not flow perceptibly under moderate stress, has a definite capacity for resisting forces (as compression or tension) which tend to deform it, and under ordinary conditions retains a definite size and shape
:the part of a solution or suspension that when freed from solvent or suspending medium has the qualities of a solid usually used in plural milk solids
:something that is solid: as
:a solid color
:a compound word whose members are joined together without a hyphen
:in a solid manner
:unanimously
:the three-dimensional angular spread at the vertex of a cone measured by the area intercepted by the cone on a unit sphere whose center is the vertex of the cone
:a branch of geometry that deals with figures of three-dimensional space
:giving an impression of solid worth or substance solid–looking citizens
:a mathematical solid conceived as formed by the revolution of a plane figure about an axis in its plane
:relating to the properties, structure, or reactivity of solid material

:relating to the arrangement or behavior of ions, molecules, nucleons, electrons, and holes in the crystals of a substance (as a semiconductor) or to the effect of crystal imperfections on the properties of a solid substance solid–state physics
:utilizing the electric, magnetic, or optical properties of solid materials solid–state circuitry
:using semiconductor devices rather than electron tubes a solid–state radio
:any of the five possible regular polyhedrons that include the regular forms of the tetrahedron, hexahedron, octahedron, dodecahedron, and icosahedron
